I'm taking the blade to my polisher tomorrow so I'll see what he says about
it.
 
It is a very thick blade so hopefully it can be saved; the reverse side of
the blade has no pits at all.
I'm guessing at worst it could be cut down into a wakizashi as the major
pitting and corrosion is all confined to the top 6 inches of the blade. The
blade is still holding a good edge and cuts well over the entire length so
I'm not worried about the temper.
 
Thanks for everyone's help.
 
Peter
 
  _____  

From: nihontochicken [mailto:rick@...]

Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Will this Katana polish?
 
PPS -

I didn't look at all the pics before, and just now saw pic #2 with 
the HUGE pit right on the shinogi.  Ouch!  An incredible amount of 
the sword would have to be taken off the ji and shinogi ji in order 
to make the shinogi sharp again.  Unfortunately, my feeling is that 
this sword is toast, a terminal victim of poor care.  Sigh.

NC
